parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

datasetStructure: One record per property or setting per time point per visit or test date per subject

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Expected in this domain as devices may have settings or uses that either may not involve subjects (e.g., diagnostic tools) or devices that are removed from the study prior to contact with a subject (e.g., device has malfunction).
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DUSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier for a group or block of related records. Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject or a group of subject related records (e.g., group records specifying all the settings for a specific imaging scan, such as field strength, repetition time and echo time).
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: DUGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external identifier. This could be a scan code or equivalent.
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: DUREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: DUSPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106483

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in DUTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DUTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). DUTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "COILSTR", "CNTMEDIA".
datasetVariables.label: Device-In-Use Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: DUTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106482

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in DUTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Coil Strength", "Contrast Media".
datasetVariables.label: Device-In-Use Test Name
datasetVariables.name: DUTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUCAT

datasetVariables.description: Defines a category of related records. It can be used to define the type of device for which settings are recorded if DI is not used (e.g., if the device is not under study); may also be used to record the type of setting (e.g., "HARDWARE" vs. "SOFTWARE").
datasetVariables.label: Category for Device-In-Use
datasetVariables.name: DUCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of a measurement or examination. For example, if DUCAT = "SOFTWARE", DUSCAT might be "NOMINAL" or "POST-ADJUSTMENT".
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Device-In-Use
datasetVariables.name: DUSCAT

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the measurement as originally received or collected. DUORRES should contain the setting or other device condition in effect at the time the device was used.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: DUORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for DUORRES. Examples: Tesla, mm.
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: DUORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESC

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from DUORRES in a standard format or standard units. DUSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in DUSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE," "NEG," and "NEGATIVE" in DUORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in DUSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format. Copied in numeric format from DUSTRESC. DUSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for DUSTRESC and DUSTRESN. The unit for standardized results may or may not be the same as for the original results.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: A clinical encounter number. A Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. This value is usually derived.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Date/Time Device Used With Test/ Setting

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUDTC

self.title: Date/Time Device Used with Test/ Setting

datasetVariables.description: Date/time that the device was used with this setting. This is not the date/time that the setting was set on the device, but rather that date/time that a measurement or test was done using that setting.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time Device Used with Test/ Setting
datasetVariables.name: DUDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of Device-In-Use measurement, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Observation
datasetVariables.name: DUDY

description: A findings domain that contains the measurements and settings that are intentionally set on a device when it is in use. These are characteristics that exist for the device, and have a specific setting for a use instance. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102622, 2018-06-29)
label: Device-In-Use
name: DU
